event: Earliest human presence in present-day El Salvador
Early agricultural villages develop in volcanic valleys
Maya influence spreads across western El Salvador
Spanish conquest of the Pipil region begins
San Salvador is founded as a colonial settlement
Indigo production drives the colonial economy
El Salvador declares independence from Spain
Joins the Federal Republic of Central America
El Salvador becomes an independent republic
Coffee cultivation reshapes land ownership and society
Peasant uprising and repression mark a national trauma
Civil war begins between government and guerrilla forces
Peace accords end the civil war
